title: Beta prime distribution
summary: In probability theory and statistics, the beta prime distribution (also known as inverted beta distribution or beta distribution of the second kind[1]) is an absolutely continuous probability distribution. If p ∈ [ 0 , 1 ] {\displaystyle p\in [0,1]} has a beta distribution, then the odds p 1 − p {\displaystyle {\frac {p}{1-p}}} has a beta prime distribution.
